content.raw:
To me it seems like all of the affected functions are only meant for internal use, but since they're public functions I guess we can't guarantee that no one else is depending on them.

With respect to changing function signatures, one of the big problems is that Koon Peng ran into is that these classes weren't designed to support multiple “skeletons” in an animation, but many complex animations \(e.g. humanoids\) are constructed with multiple “skeletons” in them. The function signatures changes were made to accommodate that. Maybe we can keep the old function signatures and have those functions operate on the assumption that there's only one “skeleton” \(or vertex group to match the language of the new API\).

In terms of which Gazebo to target, it’s really important for us to have these fixes for our Singapore work, which is already a complex ecosystem combining ROS1 Melodic, ROS2 Crystal, and Gazebo 9. If we can get this released in a Gazebo 9 minor release, that would be ideal for us and our project partners.
